docs.title: Logs Verification
docs.text:
Login:

dexctl --user <user-id>

List all available contexts:

kubectl config get-contexts

Set current context to targeted one:

kubectl config use-context <targeted context>

docs.title: Logs for all pods / deployment
docs.text:
List deployments:

kubectl get deployments -n <target namespace>

List logs for all pods:

kubectl logs deployments/<deployment name>

docs.title: Logs for a particular pod
docs.text:
List all pods:

kubectl get pods -n <target namespace>

List logs for a particular pod:

kubectl logs <targted pod name>

docs.title: XSS: Encode for client
docs.text:
• OWASP Java Encoder helps to encode values based on client use case to avoid any XSS attack 
    // when you want to place json properties inside <script type="application/json">${toJson()}</script> in html
public String toJson() {
    ObjectMapper objectMapper = new ObjectMapper();
    try {
        return Encode.forHtmlContent(objectMapper.writeValueAsString(this));
    } catch (JsonProcessingException ex) {
        log.error("Serialization error.", ex);
    }
    return null;
}
    • Similar to html, dedicated methods available for CSS(forCssString) and JS (forJavaScript) as well
    • Similarly different encoding methods available for script/style attribute(forJavaScriptAttribute, forCssString-), block (forJavaScriptBlock) and URL components (forCssUrl, forJavaScriptSource) parameter
